sentences.en: Although they had not made love , they had secretly exchanged solemn vows and pledges, bearing their hearts to each other.
sentences.cn: 虽未成双,却也海誓山盟,私传表记, 已有无限的风情了.

sentences.en: At the most solemn moments he will flash a mocking smile or make an ironic remark.
sentences.cn: 在最庄严的时刻他脸上会闪现嘲弄的微笑或说一句讽刺挖苦的话。

sentences.en: Drums and cymbals beat out a solemn rhythm.
sentences.cn: 鼓和铙钹奏出了庄严的节奏。

sentences.en: Erica was solemn, pulling at her blonde curls.
sentences.cn: 埃丽卡表情严肃，扯着自己卷曲的金发。

sentences.en: He looked very solemn as he announced the news.
sentences.cn: 在宣布这一消息时,他显得非常严肃.

sentences.en: He was a slim, solemn, darkly handsome young man.
sentences.cn: 他是个身材修长、表情庄重、皮肤黝黑的帅小伙。

sentences.en: He wore an extraordinarily solemn expression.
sentences.cn: 他脸上带着异常严肃的表情.

sentences.en: His behaviour was not in keeping with the solemn occasion.
sentences.cn: 他的举止与这庄严的场合不协调.

sentences.en: His face suddenly turned solemn, his voice confidential.
sentences.cn: 他脸上的神情突然严肃起来，声音也压低了。

sentences.en: His solemn little face broke into smiles.
sentences.cn: 他严肃的小脸蛋上突然绽放出笑容。

sentences.en: I was sensible of her solemn grief.
The mourning hall was filled with a solemn silence.
The new Embassador was received with solemn ceremonies.
sentences.cn: 新大使受到了隆重的礼遇.
他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.en: We entered into a solemn bond.
sentences.cn: 我们缔结了一份正式合约.

words.tran_cn: 举行仪式；庄严化；隆重的庆祝
严肃起来；严肃地说（等于solemnize）
使庄严；使严肃；隆重庆祝

trans.tran_cn: 庄严的，严肃的，庄重的，隆重的，神圣的，忧郁的，阴沉的
trans.tran_en: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion
